intro: Calystegia villosa, commonly known as the hairy bindweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Convolvulaceae. It is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit and produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Calystegia villosa is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its aggressive growth and ability to spread rapidly.
